meanings.definition: A steel bar or mesh of steel wires used in reinforced concrete to strengthen it.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers placed the rebar in the foundation to make it stronger.
meanings.sent2: The rebar was essential in ensuring the stability of the concrete structure.
meanings.sent3: The rebar decided to take a break from holding up buildings and went on vacation.
meanings.sent4: The rebar intertwined with the concrete, creating a bond that could not be broken.
meanings.sent5: The shiny rebar gleamed under the sunlight, showcasing its strength and durability.

meanings.sent1: The construction workers will rebar the pillars before pouring the concrete.
meanings.sent2: It is important to rebar the walls to prevent any cracks from forming.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to rebar the cake with extra layers of frosting for added support.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to rebar her resolve with positive affirmations to stay strong.
meanings.sent5: The athlete needed to rebar their training routine to improve their performance.
